website_summaries.verdict: A feature-rich mid-price option that is easy to use and offers you a number of brewing options to meet your personal taste needs.
pros: Features include a removable water reservoir, an XL Showerhead for even brewing, and a number of brew settings
Uses Thermal Flavor Extraction to enhance brewing
cons: Carafe breaks easily and is difficult to replace
This option is taller than similar machines, which could present space issues

customer_reviews.title: We found it!
customer_reviews.text: After having a Keurig for several years, we decided to go back to a simple pot of coffee. I read a gazillion reviews and was willing to spend 3x what I spent for this gem, but in the end we are happy with our purchase. It's simple, easy to use, looks good and makes a great pot of coffee. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: John D. Ainsworth

customer_reviews.title: Coffee Tastes Like Plastic
customer_reviews.text: I ran several “water only” cycles through this coffee maker, and I cannot get the plastic taste out of my coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: NIce Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: We are picky about our coffee and this coffee maker is great. Makes consistent cups of coffee each day and makes good coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Newman

customer_reviews.title: Great features but hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this coffeemaker primarily because of the extended "stay warm" option and other settings that allow a customized pot of coffee (classic vs. rich, small brew). The plastic lid that locks into place and plastic lip on the carafe are also nice and make it more functional. The reusable mesh filter was also an important feature to us. However, after less than a month of use, the glass in the carafe is already badly stained. It is washed daily, but (even with soaking) the coffee stains won't go away. Disappointing for a coffeemaker that is otherwise well made.
customer_reviews.author: Kris M.

customer_reviews.title: Refuses to brew, light just flashes
customer_reviews.text: machine worked great for the first 4 days, then I wake up expecting the smell of coffee, nothing. The brew light is just flashing, pulsing, as if its laughing at me. I unplug it, take off the water resevior, pull out the glass carafe, filter and insert. Put it all back together, fill her up, plug it in, mash Brew....nothing...just a flashing light. the Clean button does the exact same thing. No beeps. Im perplexed to say the least. Too bad i threw the original box away due to all the great reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Tidwell

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee but...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this coffee maker, but after having this for almost a month, I noticed white residue in the sprayer and in the filter after there was no coffee in it. I've cleaned it out before using it (4 full times with a vinegar solution until it was clear) because I noticed the white residue then. Also, we ONLY use bottled water. The Ninja customer service was extremely helpful when we got this because it was received damaged and they fully replaced the damaged parts. But after having this for almost a month and noticing this white "stuff" in there, I'm very hesitant to use this again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Skaggs

customer_reviews.title: The dimensions are not accurate on the website, this maker is 16.9" tall, not 12"
customer_reviews.text: Liked the features and the height stated 12" tall. That was wrong. It's 16.9" tall. It's also quite wide with the side water reservoir. Sending unit back as it does not fit under the counter.
customer_reviews.author: I'm Just Say'n

customer_reviews.title: Coffee tastes great!
customer_reviews.text: Best to use with paper filter. Coffee tastes great! It does take 15 min to brew, but that is not a bad thing.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Cortez

customer_reviews.title: Has a great taste.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Makes hot coffee. We use less grounds than with our bunn.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Not good if you use good coffee
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Has both and hour and minute button for the timer, which makes it easy to program. -Looks good. Cons: -We make the mistake of getting the one with the re-usable filter, which means you have to rinse it out every time, rather than just tossing a paper filter. -Uses a lot of coffee. Our old Mr. Coffee needed 9 TBS to make a pot of coffee. This one needs 12 TBS. it adds up. Probably only buy this if you use cheap coffee. -Tends to leave a lot of sludge in the bottom of the cup/pot, especially on the 'rich' setting, which is much better than the watery 'classic' setting
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: After three tries I finally got a call back.
customer_reviews.text: This unit does not operate as advertised, I think because it is defective. It does not hold settings and doesn't shut off ... the stay warm stays on ... remains hot until power button is deactivated. I wish I had gone with a Mr. Coffee ... none of the bells and whistles, but it works. After three tries I finally got a call back from a support person who knew what I was talking about. He decided that the best course of action was a replacement unit that I should receive in 3 to 5 days. Very acceptable! We'll see if the new works better than the old.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Rector

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I THINK I HAVE HAD THIS COFFEE POT FOR ALMOST A MONTH NOW. IT HAS BEEN THE MOST AWESOME COFFEE POT I HAVE EVER OWNED AND I AM A PREVIOUS KEURIG OWNER. IT ACTUALLY TASTES LIKE IT CAME OUT OF A KEURIG POT. I AM SO PLEASED WITH THIS COFFEE POT. I USE COMMUNITY COFFEE IN MINE, FOR NOW. I LOVE HOW YOU CAN HAVE IT CLASSIC IF YOU WANT OR HAVE IT RICH. I LOVE IT!!! WORTH EVERY PENNY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Gombar

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, horrible pot durability, extortion for a pot replacemnt
customer_reviews.text: The pot lightly touched my stone countertop and shattered. This pot is designed to shatter and the only place you can get a new one is from ninja directly for 40.00 plus shipping. Pot shattered after about 30 days of use. My last POS coffee maker cost 1/2 as much and laster 15 years. Buyer beware. Buy a coffee maker with standard replaceable parts. Not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Whistle Tips

customer_reviews.title: No Drips & durable warmer plate
customer_reviews.text: Have had for over a year now, and the #1 thing I was looking for is a warming plate that doesn't corrode, rust, or chip from the combination of spilt coffee and/or heat. This is also the 1st pot I can think of that DOESN'T drip! Ninja did it, why is this still hard for others? So that takes care of the problem of coffee burning on the warming plate. But mainly, the Teflon finish on this plate: I have never seen this before. So far it's been fantastic. The warmer plate still looks like the day I bought it. Have also been very pleased with every other aspect of his coffee maker so far
customer_reviews.author: Steven K

customer_reviews.title: Nice Alternative to Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: When our Cuisinart coffee maker literally became a hot mess and imploded, we thought we'd try another brand. We went with this Ninja coffee maker and are mostly pleased. It's easy to use, with the measuring spoon attached to the side and easy-to-fill reservoir. The coffee flavor seems comparable to the Cuisinart. It takes longer to brew than the Cuisinart, but the carafe slides in and out more easily onto the warming plate. A couple of things we don't like: the oversized "Ninja" logo screaming on the front of the appliance. Biggest complaint: The carafe stains easily and it's hard to get the stain off.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee-maker, dreadful coffee pot . . . rip-off to replace the pot
customer_reviews.text: I like the coffee-maker. The water container is easy to load. The filter bin is easy to load and clean. The coffee brews fast and stays hot. What’s not to like? The coffee pot quickly turns brown and is very difficult to clean. Ninja needs to re-engineer this dreadful pot. With that, it would merit 5 stars. Except for this: if you break a pot it will cost you over $52 to replace it—nearly as much as an entire “refurb” unit. Ninja does not sell replacement pots through Amazon like every other supplier. You can only get it through Ninja—at a high price plus shipping cost. This disqualifies Ninja from any further purchases.
customer_reviews.author: JAM of JC

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly awesome brewer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Bonavita which after 4 years completely stopped working. I looked for a brewer that had all the features I wanted and with a very solid 4 & 5 star combined rating of 90% the Ninja was it. What surprised me most was how handily, regardless of brew mode, it consistently delivered a smoother and richer blend of coffee than I ever achieved with the Bonavita. Another nice touch is that the water reservoir is detachable for easy filling and being programmable is also a nice to have. And lastly, it has a very nice aesthetic appeal to it that adds to my kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: Mangino

customer_reviews.title: Good Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Have had this coffee maker for about a month now. Pros: Makes good coffee Easy to Clean Components seem high quality (such as the pot) Removable water container. (easy to fill up and easy to clean) Cons: none so far
customer_reviews.author: AM87

customer_reviews.title: Obtaining parts
customer_reviews.text: The glass carafe broke. I contacted Ninja. Delivery of a carafe is estimated at 10 weeks!! So can't go 10 weeks without coffee so went out and bought a Mr.Coffee. If I break the carafe, Walmart has them in stock. It is unbelievable that Ninja does not stock carafes. I asked them if I could go with a metal carafe as I know some Ninja models use or have option to have a metal carafe. Unfortunately, there is no metal carafe for my model. I would not purchase another Ninja coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Charlesworth

customer_reviews.title: My 1st coffeemaker!
customer_reviews.text: I've started loving coffee at age 40! So it was time to buy my first coffeemaker. I read many reviews, and compared many brands and models, and I chose this ninja. I love it! Easy to use, and clean, even for a newbie like me! Makes a great cup, and I love the programmable feature, plus the choice between classic or rich. I've only had it for 2 months, but I use it every day, sometimes many times a day. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: T. Steffes

customer_reviews.title: What? 19.95 charge on return shipping to repair pot?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee brewer in September, 2019. It is now January, 2020. The pot makes a fiercesome gurgling noise and boils away 1/3 of the water that never reaches the carafe. It also takes 30 minutes to make a pot of coffee. Really, it didn't begin that way, but after less than 4 months of use, the pot is toast. :0 Warranty says return costs are mine and when they send it back to me, there will be a 19.95 fee for "postage". I think not. I'll just trash it and never buy another Ninja product again. I am truly disappointed in the product's lasting ability.
customer_reviews.author: ginnyh

customer_reviews.title: Well made; very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This thing is nicely designed and feels solid and well built. The control panel provides all the flexibility you need without confusing things with a lot of extra bells and whistles. I really like how easily the water reservoir detaches for filling, as opposed to the models where you fill the pot with water and then pour it in the machine. It makes excellent coffee. I found that using the recommended one measure per cup yielded coffee that’s too strong; I’m now using about 60% of that amount. Very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: F W Hough

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean, amazing coffee with choices of flavor!  Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of Ninja Coffee Makers when I decided to purchase this one. Having the water tank on the side of the pot is a lifesaver!! Just fill it up, set it down and select brew! You never have to pour the water into a small space somewhere around the top of the pot and I've not yet spilled a drop! (for me, that's amazing!) Give this pot a try and see if you love it as much as I do. It also takes less coffee grounds per pot than any other brand I've ever used. I am a big coffee drinker, about 3 pots a day, and it deserves a very high rating!!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse McClelland

customer_reviews.title: great coffee
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes great coffee, its a drip coffee machine that stands up to all the rest. super easy to use, easy to clean, love the reusable filter and the small batch capabilities. my only complaint would be the reservoir design... its almost overkill to have a removable reservoir with a lid that could eventually get lost... or it could be on the back and save counter real estate.... and a metal carafe would have been amazing. minor issues though for an otherwise great coffee maker
customer_reviews.author: Connor S

customer_reviews.title: after trying about 6 coffee makers this NINJA is the BEST
customer_reviews.text: nice shower head, separate water tank, easy to remove and fill. good tasting coffee. Cone style filters. Heating plate is not adjustable, but does have an on and off option. The pot is a little hard to dry, when I wash it and set it upside down in the dish drainer (or dishwasher, there's a lip somehow inside so there's always a trickle of water that drains back down into the problem compared to the other 5 we tried. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lorie

customer_reviews.title: The Best Coffee Maker I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this Ninja 12 cup coffee maker for a couple of days but so far, it has exceeded my expectations in every way. The coffee tastes GREAT, it's much hotter than my previous coffee makers would produce, the water reservoir is easy to fill from the awkward, side-mounted water dispenser in my refrigerator, and the coffee pot doesn't drip when I pour it. Yay! This is the best coffee maker I've ever had, and I've had many during my 50+ years on this planet. If you're on the fence about which coffee maker to buy, I highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P.

customer_reviews.title: I like it ....
customer_reviews.text: The thing that most surprised me is the brewed coffee really tastes better than my previous coffee maker - much better, less bitter. It's no faster or easier to use, but that's not a surprise. The first one, for some unknown reason, kept resetting its clock without any reason. Because of my concerns that the electrical board might be failing, Amazon replaced it. OK - the only thing I dislike about this unit (and probably every similar coffee maker) is that the clock resets after a fraction of a second electrical burp. Why can't they include a battery that maintains the clock setting for a few minutes?
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes the machine will not brew the last 2 cups properly.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this coffee maker, this is an entry level Ninja. The only issue that I have with this is the water level and the brew time, if the water level gets to 2 cups for some reason, it will not brew the rest quickly unless I tip the machine sideways. I returned my first machine and received my second one only to experience the same result. The outcome when this happens is the coffee will be stronger if not all the water brews and it steams the remaining amount of water and the brew time takes a bit longer when it happens.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Glandon

customer_reviews.title: Made bitter coffee for a few weeks and then just stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Super frustrating... it worked for a few weeks, making bitter coffee. Our cheap coffee maker we had before was way better... we were disappointed that our upgrade turned out to be a downgrade in quality... but were living with it until it just decided to stop working one day. Now it stops brewing mid-cycle after a cup or so and there's nothing to be done about it... we troubleshot everything.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole S

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic pieces mar a Good Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes great coffee. It has been reliable. It is easy to use. However, the plastic lid part of the carafe broke in the first week of use. It’s just brittle plastic. We have been using it broken, and that’s a little irritating given the cost of this coffee maker. The plastic broke when bumped hard against a counter. Note the glass did t break. The plastic is just brittle.
customer_reviews.author: Muneraven

customer_reviews.title: Brewed good for 2 days
customer_reviews.text: After having this for 2 days it worked great, but on the third day I went to make a pot of coffee and the glass carafe cracked and broke.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Lerp

customer_reviews.title: Happy! Great coffee maker choice
customer_reviews.text: Removable water tank to refill, not the pot. Great coffee, but not super fast. Easy to refill. Programmable. Time setting warmer adjustable by hour, so coffee doesn't burn. Large carrafe. Doesn't spill when pouring. Happy!
customer_reviews.author: Casey Digital Design Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from my old one
customer_reviews.text: My Mr. Coffee went out and I had to get a new coffee maker. I wanted something that had some features but didn't need much. I chose this one because of the removable water reservoir. I had no idea Ninja had a coffee maker. I love it. I can only hope I will get more use out of it than my last one. But all in all, it's great. It has the classic and rich brew and reusable coffee filter, which were the only features I required. It isn't noisy in my opinion, and it doesn't take super long to brew. I would recommend it to any of my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Darkskittlez23

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker ever
customer_reviews.text: Loved EVERYTHING about this coffee maker. Starting with the ease of use, moving to the part where I DON'T pour water everything in my half-waking state stupor, this setup is amazing. I never had an easier to operate unit in my life and I feel like I've fought with too many. Pouring the water into the proper receptacle instead of into a black hole at the top and racing to place the pot into position is FANTASTIC. Tall people might not understand the level of difficulty there but it's a challenge. Pouring that water is a leap of faith but no more! This unit makes sense!
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne0711

customer_reviews.title: Love the Ninja
customer_reviews.text: My husband was on his second Cuisinart coffee maker since 2014... So, we wanted to give the Ninja a try since everyone else on my side of the family has one Mine came with a reusable filter, which is a must for us. The coffee maker has all the standard options that you expect to find. Still, my husband is still liking the Ninja so far. It looks good on my counter, and, most important, it makes a good cup of coffee. It is a simple Ninja coffee pot and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Got for chrismtas, love it.
customer_reviews.text: It’s sleek, easy to use and keeps the coffee nice and hot. The side tank means no more spilling water everywhere trying to fill a reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: LBasich

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee pot if you only drink one or two cups in the morning
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that it automatically turns itself off too fast for me. I drink coffee from about 6 or 7 in the morning until noon. I usually come back to find a cold pot of coffee before I am finished. Unless I am constantly going back to the coffee maker and turning it on again. I wish there was a way to configure the time before it automatically turns off because the default is way too short for me. I think it's only like 2 hours. It would probably be fine for people who just drink a few cups in the morning though. Other than that it is a great coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: CHuck

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really expect the flavor to be much different than our other coffee makers. My husband & I were surprised we could tell the difference in strength (on classic brew) and flavor. It is very, very good. The Rich brew does make the coffee have a richer & deeper flavor. Quite impressed. Highly recommend. It is easy to clean. Does take up a bit more space but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I had always wanted to try out the Nija coffee maker so I decided to give it a whirl. We haver a Kitchen Aid maker right now. The coffee maker is much larger than I thought it would be. I really like the looks of it and easy to use. We are still playing around with it and trying to make the taste of the coffee to our liking. Anytime you get a new maker it is always trying to get the taste that WE will enjoy. Just a note if you like strong coffee follow the directions. If you do not like the strong use the same amount of coffee that you previously used and just add more water.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Niedercorn

customer_reviews.title: QUIT WORKING AFTER 3 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS THE WORST COFFEE POT EVER!! It is only three months old and it WILL NOT brew. Water is in, no delay, no programming, it says brew... NOTHING. At first it would only brew 4 cups then wait for 5 hours and brew the rest. Now it just doesn't work at all. My husband is an electrician, we are pretty handy. We have watched every youtube, cleaned it, unplugged it... it has simply quit working. Save your money, our $20 Mr. Coffee made better tasting coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I almost went to a more expensive model because of some of the negatives reviews, but after using it now for about 2 months, I think I chalk those reviews up to a case of 'people on Amazon love to complain about everything.' I use the timer because I have to get out the door in the morning by 5:15am. It works really well, it's terribly easy to program and clean, and it makes good coffee (not like french press quality, but for this type of coffee maker, it's excellent). I cannot think of a single criticism, especially at this price point. I'd recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 months of ownership
customer_reviews.text: We have had our coffee maker for less than 6 months, and it just stopped working. Nothing will turn on or anything. Pretty disappointing, considering we spent $100 on this thing. The support website given on here, doesn't even have our product listed, when searching it, so I don't even know where to go to contact Ninja. I am really hoping they will replace it with a new one. We have taken care of it, and has literally been in the same spot on our counter since we have gotten it. We clean it after every use, so there is absolutely no reason why this thing should have just stopped working, except for product failure.
customer_reviews.author: jacob schubert

customer_reviews.title: One Year
customer_reviews.text: We were initially satisfied with this coffee maker, but it lasted almost 1 year to the day that we purchased it. It began making weird noises and essentially died. Headed to the trash. We expected this coffee maker to last longer than a year. We had our old Mr. Coffee for years but decided to upgrade when we purchased this one. Well, going back to the Mr. Coffee. It may take a little longer to brew and doesn't have all the bells and whistles but at least we can expect it to last longer than a year. Seriously, One Year!!!!
customer_reviews.author: William Miller

customer_reviews.title: Chugga chugga choo choo
customer_reviews.text: While it does have a lot of nice features, I'm returning this coffee maker. The steam it produces at the end of the brewing cycle makes me think of a steam engine along with the popping and spitting. I thought the removable reservoir would be nice, but it's hard to transport from the sink to the maker without spilling if you're making 12 cups. I may have lived with all of the above, but it makes nasty coffee. I tried a couple of brands, and the bitter after taste is something with which I can't. I've a couple of Ninja products I'm extremely pleased with, but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bamabelle

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Last, Not Durable, Poorly Manufactured, Poor Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Ninja coffee maker in August, 2019. It worked good for 12 months, coinciding with the 1 year warranty. 3 weeks after the warranty expired, the unit developed an internal leak and now leaks water all over the counter each time the brew cycle is run. I called customer support and of course they said it was 3 weeks out of warranty so they would do nothing. They did offer to sell me a used one with a 90-day warranty for $99.00. (I originally paid $79.00 for the new one.) This was the first Ninja product I have purchased. Based on my experience, I do not recommend the Ninja brand name.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Paul

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't brew 1 pot of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Received the coffee maker, cleaned components, and ran 2 pots of water per the instructions. Started to brew first pot of coffee and unit stopped brewing after running 2 cups of water. Could not get the coffee maker to even begin a brew cycle again. Returning the coffee maker and going to stick with a brand that has not failed us in the past
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST I'VE EVER OWNED!
customer_reviews.text: The Ninja coffee maker is the best I've ever owned. It not only looks great, it's super easy to clean. I especially like the detachable water tank. No more water spillage during pot to tank transfers & the tank is dishwasher safe, so it can be sterilized after every brewing. Best of all, the coffee tastes delicious! BOTTOM LINE: If you're looking for an affordable, easy to clean coffee maker that makes delicious tasting coffee, the Ninja coffee maker is the one for you!
customer_reviews.author: Ravenous Reader

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use - No Spills!
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this coffee pot is the large opening to the water container. You can pull the water holder off and fill it or fill it with the carafe. No spills! The carafe has a large and wide lip that keeps the liquid directed where you want it. Again, no spills. It takes a while to get the hang of the carafe lid. It is a twist and lock. Very easy to clean. We use this daily and have had it for three months now. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn

customer_reviews.title: Super coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Read 100 reviews online -- wanted to try this because you can take the water reservoir to the sink to fill. My husband used to pour water into our old coffee maker, and of course it always spilled onto the counter and floor when he was doing it. I like the shower brewing system because the grounds stay in the filter and don't overflow it. I think the taste is great. I love coffee and I love this coffeemaker. Sure, it is not one of those high - priced barista kinds, but for every day use, it is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: One of the best...EVER!
customer_reviews.text: 55+ years of brewing and drinking coffee, both in the USA and internationally, this NINJA ranks at the very top of coffee brewers we have tried. Design, filtering, timer, carafe are all first-rate. Coffee remains hot for several hours after being brewed. Easy pour! We've tried lots of coffee makers/brewers over the decades...none is better than this one!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan's Papa

customer_reviews.title: hate it- $30 basic versions are better
customer_reviews.text: I hate this coffee maker and wish i could return it. Pros: it looks good and the water is easy to add. Cons: you cannot pour coffee as it’s brewing like any basic system, the coffee pot lid doesn’t fit under the top so is a major hassle putting back and lastly the coffee tastes disgusting. Very disappointing for the price and am throwing away after less than 1 month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine but some issues
customer_reviews.text: The Ninja 12-cup is my first ever programmable coffee maker. Overall, it is a great machine. The coffee tastes good and coffee stays hot. Machine is easy to use, easy to clean and comes with useful settings. However, there are some issues. The reusable mesh filter leaves coffee grounds. Additionally, my carafe broke while washing it and getting a replacement took 3 months. The universal ones do not fit and the original was sold out on the official website for months. I had to call customer support to place an order and waited 3 months to get it. It was painful.
customer_reviews.author: Nerys Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee pot we have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This coffee pot is definitely worth the money. My dad drinks a total of ten cups of coffee throughout the entire day so we were going through mr coffee brand coffee pots every other month. So I sprung and got this one in hopes of saving me a bimonthly headache. This coffee pot brews amazing coffee! It is pretty easy to use and to clean. The only thing is the number of pieces that are involved that make it a little difficult to clean. I will also note that the pot makes the water/coffee come out like borderline boiling! Which isn’t a problem necessarily. We were just surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Chrisman

customer_reviews.title: Coffeemaker supreme
customer_reviews.text: We have had several coffeemakers through the years, and our last one bit the dust when I rinsed out coffee grounds that had overflowed into the water reservoir and that led to the clock and working innards being shorted out. So, having done a little research, we purchased this beauty and beast of a coffeemaker: the water reservoir is removable, the coffee pot lid locks into place, and it appears that, if we do have a coffee ground overflow, that the coffeemaker will withstand my cleaning the mess. Every Ninja product we own is well designed and over-engineered. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: mbick

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, easy to use, fine price, great design
customer_reviews.text: After 20 pots: permanent filter with medium size home ground beans delivers rich flavor, very smooth. PROS: Nice and hot. Controls are intuitive. Water reservoir is clever design. Carafe pours perfectly. Pause brew feature works well. Coffee stays drinkable without baking. CONS: reservoir when filled to the 12 cup line is easy to slop. After delayed brewing, the lighted controls seem haywire. Turn it off, then on, the controls are lighted properly.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho Bob

customer_reviews.title: quality product.
customer_reviews.text: i love ninja brand products they are top shelf however. it is slow to make coffee i thought it would be more like the Bunn and i considered sending it back but the good outweighs the bad and so im going to keep it. i like how the resivor detaches for filling with water and it comes with a screen filter so you don't have to buy filters plus all the timer settings is really nice. Good unit, just set the timer and it will have coffee waiting for you when you are ready.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as a supplement to my Ninja Coffee Bar (I already own 2 of those). I think, if I had purchased this first, I may not have gotten my two coffee bars. I love my Ninja products, that's why when looking for just a coffee maker, I chose Ninja. I guess I thought it would be a step above a regular machine, but it is typically a regular coffee maker, which I could have gotten cheaper without the Ninja name. STILL love my Ninja Coffee Bars, but for just a regular coffee maker, don't waste the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker - so far so good and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I miss the ease of my Kuerig, but the Ninja brews a better flavor coffee and it’s just a few extra steps to prepare. Everything works well and it’s easy to clean-especially when you use a paper filter vs the gold filter provided. I was tired of my Kuerigs dying after a year so hopefully this holds up longer. I use it multiple times a day and like the small batch brew setting.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Janson

customer_reviews.title: Best drip coffee maker I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to pay 85 bux for a coffee maker, but so happy I did. There are a couple features on this unit that really jumped out at me. One being the brew basket, so no paper liners. The other feature is the "rich" setting. I love French press coffee, but who has time for that in the morning? I can set the Ninja to the rich setting, set the auto brew for 5:45am and when I wake up and feed the dogs, I have a hot cup of coffee that tastes as good as French press!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Had this coffee maker for just 2 months, it has a removable reservoir and already the valve on the bottom leaks. I called customer support and was informed that this part is not covered by warranty. I will never buy a Sharp/Ninja product again. I have no time for a company that will back their product.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald A Dulaca

customer_reviews.title: You will love it everyday
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research when I was buying this. We drink a lot of coffee. I’ve had it for months and every day it’s a pleasure. It’s easy to program and easy to clean. It’s makes every cup great. My husband likes classic coffee and I like bold, but either way the cup tastes great. The clock is my go to in the kitchen, and it’s easy to program the time if the power went out. It’s also easy to change the delayed brew time. I like that you can remove the filter and the water reservoir. Hands down love this. I cannot find anything negative about this.
customer_reviews.author: joelle

customer_reviews.title: Really Diasappointed
customer_reviews.text: We bought a Ninja blender several years ago and it has been awesome. So figured Ninja coffee maker would be great. Very disappointed in this Ninja coffee maker. Believe it or not...the coffee was so unbelievably hot it was impossible to drink for at least a half hour, and the coffee tasted terrible. Really almost dangerously hot. Perhaps a defective heating element? We fiddled with it for about a week and were getting nowhere so returned it and got a Cuisinart which worked fine right out of the box.To be fair, the Ninja is a solidly made unit and the functions seemed to work as described. But no go on coffee,,,,,
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brophey

customer_reviews.title: As good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: My wife & I are "Coffee Driven" and have purchased the top-of-the-line Cusinart Coffee maker the last two prior purchases. After time, they both developed a leak. So this time I followed Consumer Reports suggestion and bought the Njnja coffee maker. We love that it keeps the coffee at the right temperature, brews quickly and there is a detachable water reserve. While we always make 12 cups at a time, there is an easy to use measuring spoon (which attaches to the maker) to make lesser amounts ... with a 1 measure to 1 cup water formula. Smart!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!  Extremely pleased!!
customer_reviews.text: We totally love everything about this coffee pot! Quality is excellent, totally convenient in all aspects and the coffee is fantastic! After two hours the pot stays on but the warmer turns off, it has the clean option, the regular or rich brew option, option to make a small 4 cup pot instead of full pot, outside water reservoir which is detachable, timer to set up coffee ahead. If you see this coffee pot, you will see that it has the quality and features usually only found for 2-4 times as much money. A true bargain!!
customer_reviews.author: The JONES

customer_reviews.title: Should be 5 stars. Drips when I remove the carafe
customer_reviews.text: The coffee is hot. Easy to use and set up. The flavor is fantastic. As soon as I pulled the carafe out , during brewing ,it drips and doesn’t stop. I have had 20 dollar coffee pots that stops brewing when you pull the carafe. I love it other than that but was disappointed to see this out of the gate.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: HOT!
customer_reviews.text: Turn on the warmer button and this unit keeps the coffee hot, real hot! My only complaint is the power button is hard to push, I have to hold the unit to keep it from sliding while pushing the power button, small price to pay. I'm still used to using the pot to fill the reservoir even though the reservoir is removable. Coffee brews fine.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Who Knew???
customer_reviews.text: I have never been one to spend a lot of money on a coffee maker, but I love my Ninja blender so I decided to spring for the Ninja coffee maker. LOVE IT!!!! It is so great taking the water reservoir over to our refrigerator water dispenser and get fresh filtered water instead of tap and then brewing the perfect cup of coffee. I love the Rich setting as I love a stronger brew early in the morning. Highly recommend spending the extra for a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: MNL

customer_reviews.title: Slap the ninja name on anything, people will buy it
customer_reviews.text: Horrible coffee maker for the 70$ price buttons are hard to click most of the features this Amazon as says it had it did not. Overall I'll never buy the ninja name again if I can help it waste of money no better tha. A 15$ coffee maker
customer_reviews.author: User 354

customer_reviews.title: Great cup of Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace our Mr Coffee that died the first year. Makes a great pot of coffee. As others note, it does give off a lot of steam from the top at the end of the brew cycle so be sure to pull it away from any over counter cabinets. We still use paper filters instead of just the fine screen filter included to avoid sediment in the bottom of the pot. The pot also pours nicely with little to no drips, very great!
customer_reviews.author: sparky51

customer_reviews.title: fantastic full body flavor and the coffee is popping hot!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to clean and put it together. almost everything is already to go out the box. Just run the machine with 2 full carafes of water to clean any debris from shipping and manufacturing. After that you're all set press the hours and min to set the current time after you can press the delay time set up the time and the option selection of whether you want the classic brew of Rich Brew to be the option when your coffee maker starts up on the delay time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E.

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker for the money
customer_reviews.text: Can't imagine anyone leaving a negative review on this fabulous coffee. ..and that is saying a lot these days where the market has so many bad, cheap, terrivle coffee makers sporting brand identity labels. Nice deep long brewed flavor. Components don't look or feel cheap. Water tank is removable so you can actually clean it? What a noval idea. Cover on the carafe has a funnel.that protrudes the brewed coffee to the bottom of the carafe which improves flavor.
customer_reviews.author: philipj

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker we’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Bought this primarily because of the removeable reservoir (you don’t want to know what grows in your coffee maker reservoir when it stays wet all the time). We’ve owned a lot of coffee makers in 35 years, primarily the cheaper Mr. Coffee type, and our kids have owned a number of the newer types. This makes the best coffee of any of them, just using ordinary Maxwell House and the “classic” setting. The reservoir empties completely, and we then remove the cover and it is completely dry in an hour or so. This unit has far exceeded our expectations.
customer_reviews.author: RustyCas

customer_reviews.title: Terrific, HOT coffee....love this coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee pot! Coffee is terrific and HOT. Easy to fill water reservoir (removable), easy to use display. I recommend you use far less coffee than recommended, so we use 5 scoops for full pot. I selected this pot from 5 recommended by Good Housekeeping (top rated was over $300.....way over what I was willing to pay). This pot looks like it would be far more expensive. Happy coffee drinkers....my hubby and I!
customer_reviews.author: Pat the Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: Beware. The slightest tap will destroy I replaceable carafe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee maker. I’ve had it for a few weeks and really like it. Today while washing the carafe I must have tapped the side of the sink and a chunk of glass came out of the bottom side. Inn m popped online to find a replacement and they are NOT AVAILABLE. I’m furious. So now I just take all this and throw it in the garbage? Looking for a maker without a glass carafe now. And definitely not Ninja. Such waste.
customer_reviews.author: bluesmom

customer_reviews.title: I moved up in the world of brewing
customer_reviews.text: For decades I have been a simple drip type coffee maker user. Got a wild hair and elected to step up to something more sophisticated. Although it took a bit to figure out the basic features, I must say I like it. Seems well built and intelligently designed. I am loving the programmable feature.
customer_reviews.author: PBSCRAIG

customer_reviews.title: Stopped brewing after 2 weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: Coffee maker worked absolutely fine for the first two weeks but it just stopped brewing this morning. I goggled this problem right away and it seems like it's pretty common issue. I've tried all available recommendations and nothing helped. The 'Brew' button light was just blinking. Clean button did exactly the same. I also contacted Ninja customer support but it will take a lot of time to replace it so I decided to return it back to Amazon and try another brand. 7-15-2019 upd Ordered the same model after some research, hopefully it will work this time...
customer_reviews.author: KaterinaNg

customer_reviews.title: I Look Forward to My Coffee Every Morning
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful model. I first experienced a Ninja upon renting for a month at a time on the Oregon coast. Ordered my own for a midwestern home a year ago. Water would be left in the water tank after the brew. Returned the model. The replacement did the same. Maybe it was from Costco. Drove me nuts. Returned the model. Took a chance on this model. Works great. Love the flavor of the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker - it's so easy to use and program! I love that the water basin detaches so I can fill it directly. It's fast, the coffee is good, and it keeps it warm without burning it. Also, I appreciate the handy spoon attached to the side. I will say that the glass pitcher gets dirtier than others I've had - maybe because the coffee is sealed inside more tightly? I don't know but it just requires a little more elbow grease than usual. No big deal though.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S.

customer_reviews.title: Gotta get the Ninja
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice upgrade from my Hamilton Beach coffee maker. Very sleek looking , super functional, and also I can clearly taste the difference as I am not using the paper filters anymore. So I will assume I am now getting the oils from the beans into my pot more so and it does pack more of a potent punch. Just need a good space to slide it into as it's not super narrow on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Nate,  Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Great Ninja Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is the first 'real' coffe maker I have owned. I bought the Ninja brand because I have their blender and it is the best. The coffe maker has a reservoir that you fill at the sink rather than pour the water in with the pot. It has settings for different strengths of brew. You can delay brewing and keep warm for 4 hours if needed. I'm so glad I made this purchase it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Jo Willsey

customer_reviews.title: Slow to brew
customer_reviews.text: I have taken so much crap over this coffee pot. I purchased it for an office and I have not heard the end of it from the Bunn snobs. It takes too long to brew. They have to stand at the pot for 15 minutes (I'm pretty sure this is an exaggeration). We do set the coffee pot's timer to brew before everyone gets here, but that still does not make them suffice. I like the coffee pot. But your co-workers may not.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderinwen

customer_reviews.title: Ninja keeps it’s reputation high
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to use. I love the water tank feature so I can set the coffee up for the next day without using the pot and can run it through the dishwasher. The flavor is good. The only reason I didn’t give the cleaning 5 stars is because the pot seems to get dirtier faster than my other pot did. And the coffee filter basket has to be washed after each use, even with the use of the filter. But all of that considered, I’m still very pleased with the coffee maker overall.
customer_reviews.author: Luv2fly

customer_reviews.title: Nice coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of things about this coffee maker. In fact, it is one of the best I have owned. However, it is missing one feature I used a lot with my last one. I can't program it to warm up left over coffee. I drink about half a pot a day. I like to set the timer to start the coffee maker before I get up so it is warm right away. I can do that with a new pot, but not with left over coffee.
customer_reviews.author: arc

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Only purchased a few months ago but we are serious, daily (all day) coffee drinkers and I have a picky palate. It's easy to use, I still use the carafe to fill up the water resevoir, even though the resevoir itself can be removed for filling and cleaning. I wish we didn't have to buy the cone-shaped filters but that's nit-picking. Flavor is good quality, i use the Bold setting and I do wish it brewed a bit faster. But, overall I'd definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite Ninja.
customer_reviews.text: We love the Ninja products and have several in our kitchen. We bought this coffee maker for our downstairs entertaining room It has the options for 4 cups or more but the thing that we dislike is that you have to put exactly the amount of water you want in the water holding tub for the amount you want to make. You can not fill the holding tank up and choose 4 cups. It will make the whole pot and then you have wasted your coffee. This one is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Anna- Pursuing hospitality

customer_reviews.title: good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I studied reviews and alternatives for weeks and finally decided to order this coffee maker. I am not a coffee purist so all I needed was a good dependable drip coffee maker. Here is what I like about this machine: It is solid. It makes good coffee. The pot lid locks into position so you can have confidence when you pour. No grains remain in the pot. It brews with a good heat. The controls are easy. So, no complaints. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: revdave

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee maker EVER
customer_reviews.text: I have had many, many coffee makers in my life. This one tops all of them. My son-in-law moved in with us when he started his new job near our home before the out-of-state move was complete. This coffee maker was brewing coffee three different times each day. It worked great every time and the coffee was delicious every time as well. I particularly love the removable water reservoir and the attached scoop - the perfect amount of coffee for each measured cup.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gabel

customer_reviews.title: Very good coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Makes a great cup of coffee. A little too tall, though. I keep it on a kitchen countertop, just below the wall cabinet where I keep the coffee and coffee mugs. When you have the top of the coffee maker open, you can't open the wall cabinet. Kinda annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Most Expensive Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: 7 months old and takes 45 minutes to brew a 6 cup pot. Literally timed it this morning. The most expensive piece of junk I’ve ever bought. Back to Mr. Coffee, at least those lasts a year or more and only $30.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So Far It's Great
customer_reviews.text: We have done a coffee pot in the past, then went to Keurig, then french press. Now we've come full circle. This machine is great! I love the permanent filter, easy to set for time, great cup of coffee (finally)! It does take up some space, so keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A new coffee maker to love
customer_reviews.text: My initial response to this new coffee maker is outstanding. I had to replace my Mr. Coffee pot after about 4 years due to corrosion and just didn't know what I was missing. The Ninja is designed well for ease of use and provides great tasting coffee as the right temperature. So far, I have only used the permanent filter which works great with medium grind coffee. As stateded by the manufacturer. medium grind works and my espresso grind caused a minor overflow of grinds into the pot.
customer_reviews.author: Ac64

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to hear from visitors, "Wow, this is good coffee"....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after visiting a friend who had this Ninja coffee-maker. It was the best coffee I have had in a long time. It's super easy to use. I like that you can bring the water container to the sink or leave it in place. The heating unit keeps coffee at a perfect temperature - no need to microwave for extra heat. Be prepared to say, "man, this is good coffee".
customer_reviews.author: River

customer_reviews.title: Unit died in 5th Month
customer_reviews.text: I love the machine (CE201) from the start. After using it with the delayed brew feature every morning, it wouldn’t brew. I contacted the manufacturer and after they had me go through all their “trials”, it was confirmed dead. I had to pay an additional $20 “shipping fee” to have a new base delivered. I received an older base- model CE200. I’m not impressed to say the least! Save your money and go with a brand that has legit manufacture warranties.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: So glad, tired of grind and brew
customer_reviews.text: I have had Cuisinart coffee makers for many years. About every 2-3 years I have to replace. I started having issues getting grinder out of last unit, water poured all over when filling, and lid was not easy to put on. So with my new coffee maker I really like opening top to fill coffee, a separate water reservoir. I love the slide feature to remove lid on pot. Had ground coffee versus grind and brew this morning and it tasted great. A lot less set up and cleaning. Delay worked great. I am so glad I bought this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Meaux

customer_reviews.title: I can really taste the difference
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had this coffee maker since Christmas but so far, we are loving it! The coffee takes so much better than the Mr Coffee machine that we had before and we haven’t done anything different. There’s such a richer flavor to our brew. The machine is easy to use and program. It does take about 15 minutes for a full pot but it’s worth the wait. So far, I’m impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the best coffee maker I've ever owned. Not only does it have a removable water reservoir for easy filling, but it is great for removing to keep it clean after each use. You can wash and rinse it in the sink. Every brew comes out exactly the same. The pot is designed so that there is never any spill and no water or coffee ever hits the hot plate so that stays clean. I will buy another one for when I head up north for the summer months. Makes me want to look and try out some of the other Ninja products.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Ninja coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: It makes great tasting coffee and I loved it at first. After owning it for a little over six months, it leaks from the back while it is brewing. It doesn't leak until it starts brewing and almost finished.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: The best coffee maker I have bought!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned coffee makers from 3 different major brands. 2 of them began to make only warm coffee after not much use. 1 started to leak water during the brew process just after the warranty expired. But none of them made coffee as wonderful tasting as this Ninja using the same amount of grounds. I highly recommend this coffee maker!
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME COFFEE MAKER!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an unbelievably great coffee maker! I like everything about it! So handy to have a removable water reservoir, so that you can take it over to the sink to fill and set it back on the coffee maker, instead of having to fill the coffee pot with water and then pour it into the coffee maker. Really like having two choices for coffee strength and the fact that we can set it to stay warm longer than two hours. The 'delay brew' feature is super easy to program. My number one favorite feature has got to be the wide mouth on the carafe. Coffee pours smoothly and never splashes or drips!
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: 3 or 4 months after we spent $100 on this product the water reservoir started leaking. It progressively got worse and worse until we couldn’t even fill it without it pouring out if the bottom. We bought a new replacement piece for $30 thinking it was just a freak defect and now a few months later, it’s leaking in the same part as the last reservoir (the bottom where the spring is). Clearly selling a defective product. We haven’t even had it for a year. Not interested in a new Ninja. Buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Moreno

product_meta.title: Ninja 12-Cup Programmable Coffee Maker with Classic and Rich Brews, 60 oz. Water Reservoir, and Thermal Flavor Extraction (CE201), Black/Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Size:MediumNinja Coffee Brewer is a 12 cup programmable coffee maker with Custom Brew Technology to ensure your coffee is hot, flavorful, and never bitter. From a Small Batch to a full carafe, Classic or Rich strength, you can expect the same great taste. Our removable water reservoir allows for easy filling without the mess. The brew basket lid ensures no coffee grounds end up in the reservoir. Ninja's Thermal Flavor Extraction Technology allows you to unlock the full flavor potential of your favorite ground coffee and enjoy a great tasting brew. With the Ninja XL Showerhead, rest assured your coffee grounds will be evenly saturated for uniform flavor extraction.
feature_bullets: Hotter brewing technology: Advanced boiler for a perfectly hot cup of coffee
Wake upto hot coffee 24 hour programmable delay brew allows you to prepare your brew upto a day in advance
Keep coffee fresh and flavorful upto 4 hours with the adjustable warming plate
Conveniently carry the 60 Ounces removable water reservoir to your sink for easy filling
Pour yourself a cup before the brew is complete with mid brew pause
Ensure your coffee is never diluted when brewing a small batch (1 to 4 cups) by using the Small Batch function
Gold tone permanent coffee filter; Saves money without the need for paper water filters
Included: 12 cup Glass Carafe, Ninja Integrated Scoop, Removable Water Reservoir, Permanent Filter
